Fields.DialogueText: Who in the world is that dirty creature?
She's a she, Kapitän. That's our Schiffs... dame. Hans Lüdemann.
That's... that's Miss Lüdemann? Miss Lüdemann... is that really you?
Haha, why are you addressing me like that? Mein Name ist Hans.
All right, Hans, why are you so... filthy?
I was just doing some work on the Maschine. Our ship is going to be going 0.1 knots faster now! ... I promise that it'll be worth it in the end.
But it's only... you know what? I believe you. I'm sure it will be.
Do you like doing mechanical work, Kapitän? I could always use a partner.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not exactly what you would call "mechanically inclined." Pretty much everything I touch breaks.
I've never really tried doing it, but I'd love to learn!
Of course! I love working with my hands!

Fields.DialogueText: Haha, I pity you, Kapitän.
It's never too late! I'd love to teach you!
Ausgezeichnet! Very good!
So how exactly... There are Morganas off the port bow! Everyone get to your positions for battle! How did we not see them sooner?!
@BATTLE
Hans! Are you down here?
I'm working on the Maschine some more! What is it?
I need you to come up on deck. I need to have a meeting with the entire crew.
Huh? I can't hear you! It's too loud down here!
Sorry, what are you saying? It's too loud down here!
Kapitän, are you still trying to talk to me?

Fields.MenuText: Just meet me on deck!
Just forget it! It wasn't that important anyway!
I'm about to shut this damn engine off!

Fields.DialogueText: WAS?!
I'm just going to assume you said "Vergiss es!"
Bloß nicht! It'll hurt the ship!
CAPTAIN! THERE ARE MORGANAS! WE NEED YOU TO COME QUICK!
See? I can hear that!
@BATTLE
Get into position, crew! The Morganas are practically upon us!
@BATTLE
What was that, Hans? You were supposed to be on lookout! Why didn't you warn us?!
I'm so, so sorry, Kapitän. Das tut mir leid. I guess I had my head turned, and I'm half–deaf in one ear from all the machinery... I didn't hear them. I'm really sorry.
It's all right. We got to them in time.
I forgot to turn my hearing up again, didn't I? I've taken to suppressing it if I'm going to be in the Keller for a while. Walküre thing.

Fields.MenuText: That's all right. I can barely hear anything myself.
I don't know what that's like, but I'm practically blind!
I have this weird thing where I can't always smell... I know it's not important, but makes eating terrible at times.

Fields.DialogueText: Those who are deaf together stick together... because we can't hear if someone's trying to kill us from behind.
You don't steer the ship, right?
That's awful! Aside from machinery, my first love is food. I couldn't imagine not being able to taste it.
Haha, as entertaining as this conversation is, I have some work I need to get back to.
And I'm going to go work on the engine again – see if I can't lose hearing in my other ear! Bye, Kapitän!
Ich soll mich irren? ICH soll mich irren? Did you ever stop to think that you might be wrong?! This ship is running in tip–top condition because of me!
Hans! Please calm down, there's no need for all this yelling! What are you even arguing about?
Dieser Dummkopf over there was trying to tell me that I did my job wrong, that he can hear grinding noises coming from the Maschine.
Are there grinding noises coming from the engine?
Absolutely not! My work is not sloppy!

Fields.MenuText: Why couldn't you have calmly told them that?
Do you want me to go over there and talk to them for you?
Then by all means, go yell at them! Liars aren't welcome on my ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Hab ich ja, but he just kept pushing me!
Mach dich nicht lächerlich! You're not my parent. I can take care of myself.
Der wird mich noch kennen lernen!
Morganas spotted starboard, Captain!
When do they ever stop? Everyone, you know the drill!
@BATTLE
Hello, Hans! I've been thinking lately... and there's something I wanted to ask you.
Go ahead!
Isn't Hans a boy name?
You know, I'm far from the only Walküre named after a man... and like I said, you can call me Hannah.
I know, I know. But your name is just especially... masculine.
Hans Lüdemann was a German sailor who died saving his ship, and saved the lives of many others in the process. I'm proud to share his name.

Fields.MenuText: That's a sobering story, Hans.

Fields.DialogueText: But inspiring at the same time.
And I could imagine far worse names... Sabotage, perhaps?
Oh, she is the worst.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You must really look up to him.
Still... it's a man's name.

Fields.DialogueText: You're a little hopeless, aren't you, Kapitän?
A great man. It gives me an example to follow.
Hello, Hannah! Are you ready to get started? I'm looking forward to learning the ins and outs of the machinery on board this ship.
I'm not happy with you.
What? What did I do?!
We were supposed to meet five minutes ago.
Why do five minutes matter?
Fünf Minuten VOR der Zeit, ist des Matrosen Pünktlichkeit! Your lateness implies that you don't respect me or my time.

Fields.MenuText: All right, all right. I apologize, Hannah.
I apologize, but as captain, I have many responsibilities I need to attend to. Occasionally, I'm a little late.
Five minutes doesn't matter, and I'm going to stick by that opinion!

Fields.DialogueText: Schon gut. Don't make the same mistake again.
I– I... I guess you're right. My apologies, Kapitän, I know, you are busy.
Sure, take five next time the Nixen show up as well. Apparently you hold them in higher regard than me.
Can we please turn our attention to the machinery? I was looking forward to this.
Nicht anfassen! Not unless you want to lose a limb.
I'm kidding, I'm kidding! Mach dich locker.
Right...
Captain! There's a group of Morganas approaching our ship!
I guess our lesson will have to wait. Let's go! I'm sure we can make this a quick battle.
@BATTLE
Why am I following you back to your cabin, Hannah?
I just want you to come with me to get something. I promise it'll be quick!
Fine... Whoa! What a mess! I never realized how much machinery one person could have!
What mess? Everything is right where I left it, and I need all these materials in case I ever need to replace something one day.
Like your nose, if and when you trip and fall?
Was? Are you some paragon of cleanliness?

Fields.MenuText: Well, no. I really should clean up more myself.
I can be messy at times, but nothing this bad!
Yes, I am better! I need everything to be clean all the time! I would die if I had to live like this.

Fields.DialogueText: Spoken like a kapitän who hasn't memorized where everything is.
You're just lying to yourself. You're either messy or you're not. And I am most certainly not.
We have two different definitions of cleanliness, Kapitän.
Whatever you say, Hannah. Did you find what you need?
Hier!
It's a wonder you can find anything in this cabin...
I give you my word, I know where every single item in this room is located.
Captain! The Morganas are back again! What's our plan of action?
Same as it always is. We smash them.
@BATTLE
Just look at those oil stains, though--
In two piles, sorted by size.
You have screws just sitting there--
Keeps the dust off.
Everyone, get to your battle stations! There's a Morgana situation we need to handle!
@BATTLE
Hannah! I never noticed that key you have around your neck. Does it unlock something in particular?
Hmmm? Oh, no one's ever asked me about it. This is going to be really... embarrassing.
I promise I won't make fun of you. What's it for?
This key is the key of Bremen. My hometown.
What do you like about your city?
Das Bier! Among other things. You should know: ubi sum, ibi Bremen. Where I am, there is Bremen.
Haha, I'm sorry, I just wasn't expecting the key to be a sign of patriotism, of all things.
Look, we have fantastic Bier! I always keep some in my flask right here!

Fields.MenuText: How could you drink beer?! Ugh...
Beer is my favorite.
I don't really drink alcohol.

Fields.DialogueText: How could you not drink beer?! Especially ours! It's so refreshing!
Isn't it so good?
Really, the amount of alcohol in beer is light enough to make you ignore aching muscles from hard work, but keeps you clear enough to keep working.
How about you meet me in the officers mess sometime and we can do some tastings?
Sure, that sounds great.
We'll discuss the when later, then.
Hello, Kapitän!
I'm actually on time! Are you impressed?
Pah! I'm never impressed. My entire life is a void of dark emotionlessness... Kidding!
You have a somewhat offbeat sense of humor, Hannah.
Come on, let's get to the Bier tasting!
That's an impressive array of beers.
Yeah, I asked ein bisschen around the crew for spare bottles of their favourite Bier. They're curious about the Ergebnis. Here, try some of this.
Hm... It's all right.
Don't you mean it's most amazing beer in the world?
Don't you think you're being a little too passionate about this?
Everyone has their passions, Kapitän. One of mine just happens to be German beer.

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, I'm more passionate about intellectual pursuits.
My passions are all nostalgia-based... and too embarrassing to bring up here.
Well, yes, but why pick beer of all things?

Fields.DialogueText: You do seem like the intellectual sort, Kapitän.
What?! I let you in on my secret. You should have to tell me yours now!
It's not just beer. You know that I'm passionate about machinery too. That's number one in my heart.
After having had a few more drinks, I guess yours really isn't bad at all... It does taste quite German.
Captain! We have Morganas approaching!
Then let's give 'em one!
@BATTLE
Hello, Hannah! You're looking happy today... Wait. What happened to your welder's suit? It's ripped! I can order you a new one, if you'd like.
Mach dir keinen Kopp, Käpt'n. I don't need new clothes.
But that tear...
I can just fix it. I have a sewing kit in my room, so it shouldn't be too hard. I don't believe in wasting money on new clothing if it's not absolutely necessary.

Fields.MenuText: You don't say. I always find buying new clothes invigorating.
I have no idea how to sew. I feel like I'm forced to buy clothes.
Honestly, I like patching my own clothes as well, but the Naval Protection Force prefers their captains not do that sort of thing.

Fields.DialogueText: I refuse to buy clothes unless they're absolutely on their last legs. This suit still has some life in it.
It's not too hard to learn! I can show you if you want. This one's been sewn so many times, but it still looks pretty good!
Which is just silly and a waste of resources, really.
Well, it's good to hear you're so self-sufficient.
Danke! On top of my sewing talent, I'd like to think that I have some fashion sense.
I think the Morganas agree! They're swarming to come see your clothes! How about I get you some privacy?
Haha, I think I can handle myself, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Hannah, wearing a German pin, I see?
Aber natürlich, Kapitän. You should know that I'd never pass up the chance to support my home country.
Just... be careful of what crew members see you wearing that. Many of them might not respond well.
Which begs the question of what they expect on a German ship then, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: I don't disagree with you, Hannah.
I'd prefer to keep the peace on board, if at all possible.
I just want the crew members of other nationalities to trust that you treat them fairly.

Fields.DialogueText: Das freu mich, Kapitän.
Verstanden, Kapitän.
Einverstanden, Kapitän.
Just be considerate of the crew, all right? And I'll tell them to do the same.
I can do that. Danke, Kapitän.
Not a problem, Hannah.
And I'll try to be more neutral from now on.
I would appreciate that very much.
*ALARM*
Ready, Hannah?
Natürlich, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
We did some great work on that engine today, Kapitän! Von Siemens would be proud.
Von Siemens? I've heard that name somewhere.
He's my hero! Whenever I'm about to do something, I always ask myself "What would von Siemens do?"

Fields.MenuText: Von Siemens has done some amazing things in the field of inventing.
All my heroes are writers and artists.
I'd much rather look up to a great war general. Great strategic minds are wonders to me.

Fields.DialogueText: The man invented seamines to protect Kiel! In 1848! That's incredible.
I was never much for fine art, Kapitän. But the sound of a well made engine? I think there's music there.
You need to employ strategy while inventing, you know that, right?
But you're my real hero, Hannah.
Am I now? That's as it should be! Although, if you were hoping to unseat von Siemens as my personal hero, I'm afraid you have some work to do.
Understandable, but I'm sure you'll change your mind once you see me fight these Morganas!
We'll see about that.
@BATTLE
It seems the Morganas have crept up on us, crew! Everyone to battle stations!
@BATTLE
Hannah! What were you doing out there?! We could have used more firepower, and you have a perfectly good bandolier right there!
Oh, um... it's not full of ammunition, Kapitän. This is where I keep my wrenches and hammers.
Oh.
Sorry that I didn't have the extra ammunition on me...
It wasn't your fault. One of us saw that Morgana attack coming.
Was it One-Eyed Johnny? Hey Johnny!

Fields.MenuText: Hannah! That was offensive! Go apologize to him!
That was so terrible... yet I can't help but laugh.
How he made it into the service, I have no idea.

Fields.DialogueText: Really, I'm kidding. He's a good sailor, despite the missing eye.
Everyone likes the dark humor, whether they admit it or not.
It is one of life's great mysteries, isn't it?
Oh, Hannah... what goes on in that head of yours?
A lot of very bad stuff... well, I have to go now! Bis bald, Kapitän!
Wait, what...?
Hannah, why are you just sitting on the deck with a... can?
I'm collecting money!
For what? Are you going through some hard times?
You got me... I lost all my money gambling in underground squirrel fights... Don't be ridiculous, Kapitän! I'm financially sound.
Then what's all this for?
I'm collecting donations for the DGzRS. They pull search and rescue duty in our waters.

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely! How much would you like me to give?
The INPF's got that covered, but it's a good instinct.
Oh no! I forgot my money in my other pants. Darn! Maybe next time.

Fields.DialogueText: Any amount you'd like! I appreciate any donations.
Well, every little bit helps. They need it more than we do.
Natürlich. And in the meantime someone drowns, because they couldn't get there in time. No problem.
What made you want to collect for this group?
They're in Bremen, and you know how attached I am to my hometown. Any opportunity I can take to help out, I will.
That's very good of you, Hannah. Now, how do you feel about helping out with these Morganas on the port side?
Auch gut.
@BATTLE
Where's that loud music coming from?
I believe it's coming from Hans, Kapitän.
Hannah! What in the world are you doing?
Was? I like singing at the top of my lungs! It's so exhilarating!
With a barbershop quartet, no less. It's an... interesting choice, Hans.
Was? We shave no one. We're just a Vokalgruppe, a little choir, having fun with silly songs! Join in, it's fun.

Fields.MenuText: Well, what do you know? This is pretty fun!
Really, Hans, I prefer orchestral music.
What about Duke Ellington and Billie Holiday? Everyone loves them!

Fields.DialogueText: I told you so!
Orchestral? How on earth do you sing along to that?!
Wer? Never heard of them.
Looks like your music has attracted a few Morganas. Everyone, get to your positions!
@BATTLE
Haven't we heard enough of that record, Hannah?
Ja.
Yes? That was... not the answer I was expecting to hear.
Don't get me wrong, I still love this music. But I don't have much variety of music to listen to, and I'm sure these songs get old after a while. Ich mach's aus.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure the crew will be relieved to hear as much.
Ah, silence. What sweet relief.
You look... so sad.

Fields.DialogueText: Pffft. They loved singing at the top of their lungs with me.
You don't have to look quite so pleased.
Es fehlt mir halt.
Surely there's something else you can turn your attention to.
Well, the Maschine always needs atten--
Captain! The Morganas are attacking the bridge! What do we do?
What we always do! Ready, Hannah?
Ja, ja.
@BATTLE
Hannah? You've been keeping quiet in your cabin for a while now... I'm a little concerned about you.
Kein Sorge! I was just working on a project.
Oh! Some kind of new machine?
Nö! A song!
A song?
A new song, that no one has ever heard before! A song for a group to sing. I only have a little bit of it written, though. Would you like to sing it with me?
I–I guess, if it will help.
It definitely will! Just follow the same tune. "Chasing a nightmare on a worn out ship..."
Um... (clears throat to sing) "Feels like I'm about to lose my grip..."
"... on reality! The silence hurts my ears..."
Hannah, what's the next line? There's nothing else on this paper.
That's for you to come up with.

Fields.MenuText: It's the noise that calms my fears.

Fields.DialogueText: Noise! Like the engine room... I love it!
Ja, Kapitän! Perfect!
Well, it was nice "collaborating" with you.
Captain, the Morganas are approaching the ship! We need you!
Let's get to it, Hannah.
You've got it, Kapitän!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I'm gonna drown in my own tears.
This is a disease with no cures.

Fields.DialogueText: Dark... but I like it.
So grim! Great choice! That was a very sneaky rhyme.
There you are, Hannah. I don't think it's entirely appropriate to be drinking beer while you're on duty, you know.
Entspann dich. I just finished my duties.
All right, all right.
Außerdem, all of my best ideas come to me when I'm drinking.
Oh, is that what you're sketching on that paper?
Naja. Do you have any ideas?

Fields.MenuText: Something to help the engine run even more efficiently?
You should design a catapult that will fling large objects at the Morganas!
How about an android that will complete all the tasks on this ship?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm.... nee die passt schon. I need a new project.
Lustig, but I don't think it's what I'm looking for right now.
Klar! Let's build something fantastic!
So what are you going to do, then?
Oh! Ich hab's! Husch! I need tranquility to work on it.
There are Morganas approaching! You can work on your design later, we need to handle this first.
@BATTLE
Hannah? I need you to come out of your cabin now. I know you like working on your projects alone, but you have some duties to attend to.
Ja, ja. I'll come out.
Have you made any progress?
Selbstverständlich! It's going to be the most amazing thing ever...
Can you tell me what it is?
Streng geheim.

Fields.MenuText: I hate surprises! Just tell me now.
I do like surprises...
Whatever you say. It's your project...

Fields.DialogueText: Nein! Not until it's finished.
Gut.
Eben.
Now about your duties...
Captain, Captain! Morganas! Outside! Now! Quick!
Sounds urgent, Hannah. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Kapitän! I finally finished my project...
Oh, good! Where is it?
Genau hier! I know it's small, but it's powerful. Once installed, it will help the guns fire faster. Perfect for our fight against the Nixen!
Is that so? Can I have a demonstration?
Here, why don't you have the honor of equipping it? See, you just put it there, and...
Ow! Damn, that hurt... You didn't mention that it would snap back like that.
Was? It hurt you?! Oh mein Gott, das tut mir so leid!

Fields.MenuText: Hannah, it's fine. My thumb will probably just swell up a bit, but it'll be back to normal before you know it.
You really should've warned me about that... but it's fine. Nothing terrible happened.
It's probably broken! Damn it, Hannah!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm very, very, very sorry, Kapitän. Bitte sei nicht sauer auf mich! I promise it was an accident.
Das tut mir leid! It's never done that before. It wasn't on purpose, I promise.
Please don't be angry, Kapitän... I'm just doing my best. I didn't know that was going to happen. Das tut mir so leid...
I'm going to head down to sick bay, just to have one of the corpsman check it out to be safe.
Ach... I'm so sorry...
Damn it, and now there are Morganas coming in. This will have to wait...
@BATTLE
Hannah! There you are!
Sorry, Kapitän, can't talk. I'm busy here in the engine room.
You've been spending a lot of time down there recently. It's not good to spend your entire day in darkness.
Maybe that's what I deserve...
Deserve? Wofür?
For what? I severely injured you!
You did not. My thumb doesn't even hurt anymore. It was an accident, that's all.
Trotzdem, Kapitän! Make small ones often enough, and you'll work your way up to big ones, eventually.

Fields.MenuText: But no one is infallible. You can't expect to be perfect.
Just take what happened as motivation to avoid future accidents.
Stop it. You're being too hard on yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Doch! You and this Mannschaft deserve perfection.
Also... that may work...
Nein, this is what I deserve.
Maybe...
Maybe what, Kapitän?
Captain! The Morganas are back again!
I'll tell you after we deal with those Morganas. Let's win this!
@BATTLE
Why did you call me here again, Kapitän? I'd like to be left alone for a while...
I want you to look at this picture, Hannah. Do you know who this is?
Of course. It's Werner von Siemens... but where did you get that book? I have that same book!
That, uh, that doesn't matter right now. Here's my point.
Don't insult my hero!
If you're able to look past his mistakes, why aren't you able to look past your own?
Lives depend on me not making mistakes, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: You never know... von Siemens's could have, as well.
He did kill an elephant, once.
Still, he was no stranger to controversy.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you really think so?
That was Edison, not von Siemens! How dare you get them confused?
I guess that's true...
You have the support of both me and the crew, Hannah. If we believe in you, why shouldn't you believe in yourself as well?
Captain, come quick! The Morganas are approaching!
Come on, Hannah. I think this fight will be good to get you back on your feet. Maybe we can even use your invention.
@BATTLE
Congratulations, Hannah!
Hä? Was?
Great job, Hannah!
What's happening?
You didn't realize? We installed your invention prior to that last battle yesterday. The gun we tried it on worked great.
Echt? It worked? It... helped?
A small difference, but the crews claimed that gun had given them some trouble before, but your device sorted it out.
Danke, Kapitän. I can't thank you enough! Anything I can do for you and the Mannschaft in return?

Fields.MenuText: Seeing you this happy is enough.
Just keep inventing. We need your skill.
Anything, you say?

Fields.DialogueText: I am so happy!
Jawohl, Kapitän!
Within reason, Kapitän.
How about if you just help me fight these Morganas?
I can do that!
@BATTLE
I need everyone to get to their stations now! We have a huge fleet of Morganas heading toward us!
@BATTLE
Where's Hannah?! Hans! Hannah!
Kapitän, calm down! I'm right here. Bloß einmal Hölle und zurück. Satan's a peculiar character.
Hannah, you pushed me out of the line of fire during that battle. How can I ever thank you?
Schon gut.
You put yourself in harm's way for me. I can't thank you enough.
Jederzeit, Kapitän! We can't afford to lose you.

Fields.MenuText: That doesn't mean I want you willingly endangering yourself. You know that, right?
You know I'd do the same for you, right?
I'm not emotional right now. You're emotional right now.

Fields.DialogueText: I had everything under control, Kapitän.
Memento mori, Kapitän. I'm a Walküre, however.
Na dann.
I won't forget this.
Calm down, Kapitän. Du bist echt voll drauf, was? Come on, let's go unwind together. I think you're due for a cold beer.
The Morganas are back and they're coming in fast! We need to get ready now!
@BATTLE
That last pass was so unbelievably close. If our ship had been going any slower, they might have actually managed to collide with us!
Perhaps... a tenth of a knot slower?
Ha! I guess so...
I told you it was going to be worth it in the end.
Lucky break on all our parts, I'm sure. Unless you have insider Morgana information.
Nein, nein. I just have an intuition for this kind of thing.
Well, I don't know what we would have done without it. Or you, for that matter.
Danke, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: I'm thrilled to have you as a partner.
You're just... very special, Hannah.

Fields.DialogueText: What did you say? Du bist so leise.
BATTLE STATIONS, HANS!
Got it!
